choices.C: In Android Settings, ensure that "Allow non-Play Store apps from unknown sources installation" is unchecked.
choices.B: In the Application Management menu, configure the whitelist of apps that Android, iOS devices, and Active Sync devices are allowed to install.
choices.A: In the Application Management menu, configure the whitelist of apps that Android and iOS devices are allowed to install.
choices.D: In Device Management > Setup > Device Approvals menu, configure the "Requires Admin approval" option.

discussion.content: c it is
D is correct. C would limit only apps installed from Android devices

comments.content:
"Allow non-Play Store apps from unknown sources installation" is an Android control, not IOS (The Play Store is Google after all). D refers to device enrollment, not application control.

The answer is C.

https://support.google.com/workinsights/answer/9262835?hl=en

Work Insights is a reporting tool for G Suite that gives you insights into the impact of your G Suite deployment. Using easy-to-read charts, you can see metrics on your organization's G Suite adoption, productivity, and collaboration.

questions.question_text:
Your organization deployed G Suite Enterprise within the last year, with the support of a partner. The deployment was conducted in three stages: Core IT, Google
Guides, and full organization. You have been tasked with developing a targeted ongoing adoption plan for your G Suite organization.
What should you do?

choices.A: Use Google Guides to deliver ad-hoc training to all of their co-workers and reports.
choices.B: Use Work Insights to gather adoption metrics and target your training exercises.
choices.D: Use a script to monitor Email attachment types and target users that aren't using Drive sharing.
choices.C: Use Reports APIs to gather adoption metrics and Gmail APIs to deliver training content directly.

choices.D: Create a content compliance rule in the G Suite Admin console to change route to your-company@cloudprovider.com
choices.C: Create a recipient map in the G Suite Admin console that maps customercare@your-company.com to your-company@cloudprovider.com
choices.B: Create a rule to forward mail in the customercare@your-company.com mailbox to your-company@cloudprovider.com
choices.A: Create a mail contact in the G Suite directory that has an email address of your-company@cloudprovider.com
